alert.note: Alert for Miami-Dade (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued June 04 at 4:03PM EDT by NWS Miami
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 6 PM EDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of South Florida, including the following county, Miami-Dade. * WHEN...Until 600 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 400 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated an area of showers over the everglades will be moving northeast into metro areas of Southeast Miami-Dade County. These showers will be capable of producing up to another half to one inch of rainfall on top of the already 6 and 8 inches of rainfall have fallen over this area from the last night and this mornings heavy rains. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. If the rainfall amounts increase more than forecast, then a Flash Flood warning may be needed for this area. - Additional rainfall amounts up to 1 inch are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Coral Gables, South Miami, Kendall, The Redland, Pinecrest, Richmond Heights, Zoo Miami, The Crossings, West Perrine, West Kendall, Country Walk, Richmond West, Palmetto Bay, Sunset, Kendale Lakes, The Hammocks, Cutler Bay, Olympia Heights, Glenvar Heights and University Of Miami. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads. Please report flooding to your local law enforcement agency when you can do so safely.
